clinical_study.brief_title: Non-Interventional Post-Marketing Safety Study on the Long-Term Safety of HYQVIA (Global)
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional Post-Marketing Safety Study on the Long-Term Safety of HYQVIA (Global)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the proposed study is to acquire additional data (including the assessment of anti-rHuPH20 antibodies) on the long-term safety of HYQVIA and to assess the prescribed treatment regimens and treatment administration in routine clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all related serious adverse events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all SAEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of non-serious adverse events (AEs), related and not related, local and systemic.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Infections
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and titer of binding and neutralizing antibodies to rHuPH20
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Regimen: Total dose administered
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Regimen: Infusion interval
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Administration: Actual volume per infusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Administration: Maximum infusion rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Administration: Mean rate of infusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Administration: Duration of infusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Administration: Number of infusion sites per infusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life: Short Form-36 (SF-36)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months in first year of study, annually for remainder of study

primary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life: EuroQol 5-Dimension (EQ-5D) Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months in first year of study, annually for remainder of study

primary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication-9 (TSQM-9)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months in first year of study, annually for remainder of study

primary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life: Treatment Preference Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: Annually throughout the study

primary_outcome.measure: Health resource use: hospitalizations
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Health resource use: length of hospital stay
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Health resource use: acute care visits
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Health resource use: Emergency Room visits
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Days missed from work/school
primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period of approximately 5 1/2 years

arm_group.description: Participants with rHuPH antibody titers â‰¥160 (tested in Epoch 1)

intervention.description: Immune Globulin Infusion 10% (Human) with Recombinant Human Hyaluronidase

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples (plasma) for antibodies against recombinant human hyaluronidase (rHuPH20) that remain after study testing will be stored at the Central Laboratory to confirm implausible or critical test results, if required. Samples will be stored in a coded form and according to local requirements for a maximum of 2 years after the final study report has been completed and subsequently will be destroyed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participant requires immunoglobulin treatment for primary immunodeficiency disease (PIDD)
2. Participant age is compatible with local package insert requirements
3. Participant has been prescribed or has started treatment with HYQVIA (Immune Globulin (Human) 10% with rHuPH20)
4. Participant is willing and able to comply with the requirements of the protocol.
5. Female participant of child-bearing potential agrees to inform the investigator if she becomes pregnant, or plans to become pregnant during the course of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Participant has known hypersensitivity to any of the components of the medicinal product
2. Participant has participated in an interventional clinical study involving a medicinal product or device within 30 days prior to enrollment or is scheduled to participate in an interventional clinical study involving a medical product or device during the course of this study
3. Participant is a family member or employee of the investigator
4. Participant is planning to become pregnant, pregnant or breastfeeding at the time of enrollment
